question: From north towards south, which one of the following is the correct sequence of the given rivers in India?
explanation: The correct sequence of the rivers in India from north towards south is Shyok – Zaskar – Spiti – Satluj. Shyok flows through northern Ladakh in India. Zaskar River flows in north-eastern part of Ladakh. Spiti River is situated at Kaza in Himachal Pradesh at an elevation of 12500 feet. Satluj River rises from slopes of Kailash and flows in south-westerly direction to Himachal Pradesh & Punjab.
